title: 'Chanakya' of Bengal politics, Mukul Roy, once Trinamool's No. 2, dies at 71
desc: Once a close aide of Mamata Banerjee and considered the party’s second-in-command, Mukul Roy surprised many when he jumped ship to join the BJP in 2017, barely two years before the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. In the last two years, Mukul Roy had been in and out of hospital, with his health deteriorating by the day.

title: appointed as general secretary at party congress
desc: The announcement by the rubber-stamp party congress comes as little surprise.

title: Researchers show red blood cells drive better glucose tolerance at high altitude
desc: Chronic hypoxia improves glucose tolerance in mice through insulin-independent mechanisms, with red blood cells acting as a major systemic glucose sink. Increased erythrocyte production and altered glycolytic flux help reduce circulating glucose while supporting oxygen delivery to tissues.

title: UK graduate jobs drop below 10,000 for first time
desc: Employers advertised 694,940 jobs in January, a 3.05% monthly fall extending last year’s decline, weakest since January 2021.

title: India loses another Tejas jet to suspected technical glitch, pilot ejects safely
desc: Under investigation, the Tejas fighter jet suffered severe damage during landing after a routine sortie, though the pilot ejected safely. Following the accident, the Indian Air Force has grounded its entire fleet of around 30 single-seat Tejas jets to carry out an intensive technical probe.

title: What Drivers Said after Atlanta Cup race won by Tyler Reddick, team owner Michael Jordan
desc: There was much to discuss after Tyler Reddick and team co-owner Michael Jordan won a second consecutive race to start the 2026 NASCAR Cup Series season.

title: Bitcoin falls below $65,000 as Trump tariff moves raise uncertainty
desc: Bitcoin fell more than 5% to below $65,000 after President Donald Trump announced plans to raise global tariffs to 15%, rattling risk sentiment across markets.
